summary: The provided documents do not contain any information about John Bailey. Instead, they focus on the testimony of retired FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) regarding investigations into Martin Luther King Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. The documents detail Sentinella's involvement, including electronic surveillance, alleged communist connections, and FBI operational policies related to these investigations. There is no mention of John Bailey or his role in any of these events.
significance: Since John Bailey is not mentioned in the provided documents, his significance in the JFK context is unknown.
